issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.summary: better error message for euca-create-snapshot is required

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: AWS Error Code InvalidVolume.NotFound Not Supported

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: *Assessment* When using a volume not associated with the account of a given user, with euca-create-snapshot, the following error is returned: {code} $ euca-create-snapshot vol-84E13F04 --region account2-user11@ euca-create-snapshot: error (CreateSnapshotType): example: [Volume size=null scName=null partition=null parentSnapshot=null remoteDevice=null localDevice=null fullName=null tags=null ownerUserId=null ownerUserName=null ownerAccountNumber=137614824505 ownerAccountName=null uniqueName=null ownerFullNameCached=null state=null lastState=null stateChangeStack=null displayName=vol-84E13F04 id=null version=null creationTimestamp=null lastUpdateTimestamp=null naturalId=null] {code} Per AWS behavior, the error code [InvalidVolume.NotFound|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html#api-error-codes-table-client] should be returned. {code} $ aws ec2 create-snapshot --volume-id vol-3ac21676 --profile harold-work A client error (InvalidVolume.NotFound) occurred when calling the CreateSnapshot operation: The volume 'vol-3ac21676' does not exist. {code} *Signs* * Debug message from euca-create-snapshot: {code} $ euca-create-snapshot vol-84E13F04 --region account2-user11@ --debug 2014-04-05 23:10:10,385 DEBUG CreateSnapshot parsed arguments: {'userregion': 'account2-user11@', 'Description': None, 'url': None, 'VolumeId': 'vol-84E13F04', 'shell_configfile': '', 'deprecated_sec_key': None, 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None} 2014-04-05 23:10:10,385 DEBUG Config current user set to 'account2-user11' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,385 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'ec2-url' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,385 DEBUG Config section 'LayinDaSmackDown' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,385 INFO Config option 'ec2-url' = 'http://10.104.1.216:8773/services/Eucalyptus' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'verify-ssl' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 DEBUG Config section 'LayinDaSmackDown' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 DEBUG Config section '*' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 INFO Config option 'verify-ssl' not found 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 DEBUG Config searching users for option 'key-id' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 DEBUG Config section 'account2-user11' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 INFO Config option 'key-id' = 'AKIXRIG7SH8OSHDKU9BM' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 DEBUG Config searching users for option 'secret-key' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 DEBUG Config section 'account2-user11' 2014-04-05 23:10:10,386 INFO Config option 'secret-key' = 2014-04-05 23:10:10,390 INFO CreateSnapshot parameters: {'Action': 'CreateSnapshot', 'Version': '2013-02-01', 'VolumeId': 'vol-84E13F04'} 2014-04-05 23:10:10,390 INFO Eucalyptus sending request (attempt 1 of 3) 2014-04-05 23:10:10,391 DEBUG EC2CompatibleQuerySigV2Auth string to sign: 'POST\n10.104.1.216:8773\n/services/Eucalyptus\nAWSAccessKeyId=AKIXRIG7SH8OSHDKU9BM&Action=CreateSnapshot&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2014-04-05T23%3A10%3A10Z&Version=2013-02-01&VolumeId=vol-84E13F04' exist. {code} *Steps* * Set up Eucalyptus 3.4.2 cloud * Create two accounts, and a user under each account * Add IAM policy that has at least the following EC2 Actions for both users: ** CreateSnapshot ** CreateVolume * Create a volume with a user under one account, then try to create a snapshot using that volume from a user from the other account; observe the error
fields.summary: euca-create-snapshot returns vague error when using invalid volume
